title: Olivia Buckland BLASTS 'hyped-up' male fan for commenting on her choice to go braless
text:
Olivia Buckland has thrown her support behind the 'Free The Nipple' movement after a fan made a comment about her choice not to wear a bra.

The Love Island star, 25, shared a smouldering snap on Twitter on Thursday evening, in which she wore a one-shouldered, champagne-hued dress with a no bra underneath, to which the fan responded: 'Is it cold in there Olivia?'.

Clearly incensed by the comment about her choice to go without a bra, Olivia responded with a response in which she supported the #FreeTheNipple campaign.

Oh my! Olivia Buckland has thrown her support behind the 'Free The Nipple' movement after a fan made a comment about her choice not to wear a bra

Olivia looked stunning in her latest snap in which she was flashing her assets from beneath the thin, wet-look material.

While she was oozing confidence in the shot, she appeared irked when the fan asked her about her assets and her eye-popping display.

She penned: 'No child they’re called nipples & It’s 2019 I can choose not to wear a bra without some hyped up lad getting buzzing & making an overused boring comment about seeing some for the first time through a dress.'

In a nod to the Free The Nipple movement, which is a topfreedom campaign created in 2012 during pre-production of a 2014 film of the same name, she then rounded out her post by writing: 'Grow up will you. #FreeTheNipple'.

Hitting back: The Love Island star, 25, shared a smouldering snap on Twitter on Thursday evening, in which she wore a one-shouldered, champagne-hued dress with no bra underneath, to which the fan responded: 'Is it cold in there Olivia?'

Olivia's post came shortly before she jetted off to the Himalayas for a trek in aid of the CoppaFeel! charity to raise money for breast cancer awareness.

Away from her charity work and activism, in a recent interview with MailOnline, Olivia revealed her mother was 'scared' for her to do a reality TV show with her husband Alex Bowen.

The fashion designer, who found love with Alex on the 2016 series of Love Island where they finished as runners up, admitted some of her family had reservations about her returning to the world of reality TV.

Olivia and Alex documented their wedding on TLC's Olivia and Alex Said Yes with their latest series, Happily Ever After, documenting their married life.

Tough: Away from her charity work and activism, in a recent interview with MailOnline, Olivia revealed her mother was 'scared' for her to do a reality TV show with her husband Alex Bowen

She explained: 'We were a bit scared to do reality TV as a couple. My mum was scared. She was worried about us being at the forefront of it all. But she loves it now.'

The pair told how they were more than happy to show all aspects of their relationship on the series but wanted their families kept away from the cameras.

Alex said: 'TLC did our wedding programme. They never asked us to do anything we didn't want to do. It's happy and fun and loving.

'It feels like so long ago now since we filmed it. When we watched it back, we had forgot half of it.'
